You are given a chessboard of size $1 \times n$ where $n$ is an even number. The chessboard has a pattern of alternating black and white squares ("BWBW...BW"). Some squares on the board have chess pieces, and each square can have at most one piece. You know the total number of pieces.

You can move one piece one square to the left or right in one step. You cannot move pieces off the board or onto squares that already have a piece.

Your goal is to move all the pieces so that they are all on the same color squares (either all black or all white) using the fewest moves possible.

**Input:**

* The first line contains the size of the chessboard, $n$.
* The second line contains $k$ numbers, where $k$ is the number of pieces. Each number represents the initial position of a piece on the board.

**Output:**

* Print the minimum number of moves required to place all the pieces on the same color squares.

You have a chessboard with an even number of squares. Some squares have pieces on them. You can move each piece one square left or right, but not off the board or onto a square with another piece.  Find the fewest moves needed to get all the pieces on squares of the same color.
